head.title: Equity and Convertible Debt Offerings Scheduled for This Week

hedline.hl1: Equity and Convertible Debt Offerings Scheduled for This Week

block.p: The following equity and convertible debt offerings are expected this week:
ABR Information Services Inc., Palm Harbor, Fla., 3.1 million shares. Montgomery Securities.
The following equity and convertible debt offerings are expected this week:
ABR Information Services Inc., Palm Harbor, Fla., 3.1 million shares. Montgomery Securities.
Advanced Tissue Sciences Inc., La Jolla, Calif., 3 million shares. Goldman, Sachs & Company.
Ambac Inc., 3.8 million of preferred redeemable increased dividend securities due in 2001. Merrill Lynch & Company.
Analogy Inc., Beaverton, Ore., an initial public offering of 2.5 million shares. Needham & Company.
Biofield Corp., Roswell, Ga., an initial public offering of 1.8 million shares. Hambrecht & Quist.
Centennial Technologies Inc., Billerica, Mass., 1.35 million shares. Needham.
Century Aluminum Co., Ravenswood, W. Va., an initial public offering of $488.75 million. The share size has not yet determined. Merrill Lynch.
Cimatron Ltd., Givat Shmuel, Israel, an initial public offering of 1.85 million shares, including 1.7 million in the United States and Canada. Oppenheimer & Company.
Cineplex Odeon Corp., Toronto, 45 million shares. CIBC Wood Gundy.
Dawson Production Services Inc., San Antonio, an initial public offering of 2.275 million shares. Jefferies & Company.
Eagle River Interactive Inc., Avon, Colo., an initial public offering of 3.65 million shares. Salomon Brothers.
Elamex, S.A. De C.V., Chihuahua, Mexico, an initial public offering of 3.15 million shares. Goldman, Sachs.
First USA Paymentech Inc., Dallas, an initial public offering of 5.1 million shares. Merrill Lynch.
Global Directmail Corp., Port Washington, L.I., 4 million shares, including 3.2 million in the United States and Canada. Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette.
Guilford Pharmaceuticals Inc., Baltimore, 2 million shares. Oppenheimer.
Intelligent Medical Imaging Inc., Palm Beach Gardens, Fla., an initial public offering of 3 million shares. Smith Barney Inc.
Intelliquest Information Group Inc., Austin, Tex., an initial public offering of 1.925 million shares. William Blair & Company.
Logal Educational Software and Systems Ltd., Kiryat Shmona, Israel, an initial public offering of 1.9 million ordinary shares. Lehman Brothers.
Microware Systems Corp., Des Moines, an initial public offering of 2.5 million shares. Alex. Brown & Sons.
Nicollet Process Engineering Inc., Minneapolis, an initial public offering of 1.2 million shares. R. J. Steichen & Company.
Omnicare Inc., Arlington, Va., 5 million shares, including 4 million in the United States and Canada. CS First Boston.
Onyx Acceptance Corp., Irvine, Calif., an initial public offering of 2.5 million shares. Prudential Securities Inc.
Panamerican Beverages Inc., Mexico City, 6 million of class A shares, including 4.8 million in the United States and Canada. Smith Barney.
Pioneer Financial Services Inc., Schaumburg, Ill., $65 million of convertible subordinated notes due in 2003. Bear, Stearns & Company.
Praxair Inc., Danbury, Conn., 11 million shares, including 8 million in the United States and Canada.
Qualmark Corp., Denver, an initial public offering of 1.35 million shares. Summit Investment Corp.
Semiconductor Laser International, Vestal, N.Y., an initial public offering of 1.6 million shares and 1.6 million warrants. Whale Securities Co.
Smartserv Online Inc., Stamford, Conn., an initial public offering of 1.5 million shares and 1.5 million warrants. Rickel & Associates Inc.
Thermoquest Corp., San Jose, Calif., an initial public offering of 3 million shares. Natwest Securities.
Vyrex Corp., La Jolla, Calif., an initial public offering of 1 million units, each unit represents one common share and one warrant. First Equity Corp. of Florida.
Workgroup Technology Corp., Lexington, Mass., an initial public offering of 3.5 million shares. Alex. Brown.
Xeikon N.V., Mortsel, Belgium, an initial public offering of 6.4 million American depository shares, each representing one share, including 4.48 million in the United States and Canada. Alex. Brown.
Source: MCM Corporatewatch.
